Description: Fragment of body of Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery amphora. Short tongues: four women dancers. Purple for slippers (worn by first and third women, the other two - as often in Clazomenian black figure ware - being barefoot); for two stripes on dark area below panel; on necking ring. White for flesh of women, dots on the incised fillets, stars on skirts.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: BMC B.125.4 and part of 14. BSA xlvii, 131-C II. 1.
Reconstructed with BM GR 1888,0208.73.e and 1888,0208.77.b Findspot number '18' is pencilled on BM GR 1888,0208.106.h and '19' on 1888.0208.73.e
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B125.4)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 593, 2)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 166)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
